publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:51

did.unittitle: Zimbabwe collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, and photographs relating to the history of Zimbabwe and current political, economic, and social conditions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator. Transferred from the Zeta Collection, Mudd Library, 2004.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Zimbabwe Collection (MS 1551). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in the original accession is arranged chronologically, with scrapbooks and photographs last. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, and photographs relating to the history of Zimbabwe and current political, economic, and social conditions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The accession contains oversized photographs of Southern Rhodesia. Some of the photographs document a visit by the British royal family in 1947 and include images of King George VI, Queen Elizabeth, and Princesses Elizabeth and Margaret. The prints show the royals inspecting the troops, relaxing with dignitaries, attending various functions, and visiting famous sites, such as the grave of Cecil Rhodes and Victoria Falls. The majority of the photographs, however, depict the landscape of Southern Rhodesia under colonialism, including images of natives, colonists, and various buildings and monuments. The accession also contains photograph descriptions, which match the order of the photographs. The images and descriptions appear to have been produced by the public relations department of Southern Rhodesia.
